title: Atletico Madrid defender Lucas Hernandez jeered by Barcelona fans following arrest for domestic abuse
text:
Sport Atletico Madrid defender Lucas Hernandez jeered by Barcelona fans following arrest for domestic abuse The stopper played for his side against the Catalan giants in the Copa del Rey on Tuesday evening Share Hernandez in action against Barcelona (Photo: Alex Caparros / Getty)   
Atletico Madrid defender Lucas Hernandez was jeered by Barcelona fans after playing at the Nou Camp four days after his arrest for domestic abuse. 
The stopper was in action for his side against the Catalan giants in a feisty Copa del Rey affair on Tuesday evening. 
There were three red cards in the second leg of the tie which finished in a 1-1 draw giving Barca a 3-2 aggregate win and booking their place in the final. 
Hernandez was in court on Monday for allegedly assaulting his girlfriend Amelia Llorente. Hernandez leaving court on Monday (Photo: Europa Press/Getty Images) 
The couple both required minor treatment for injuries sustained in the incident in the early hours of Friday morning, which led to Miss Llorente calling the police. 
Frenchman Hernandez, 20, is facing up to seven months in prison if found guilty of assaulting his girlfriend, Spanish newspaper AS report. 
Miss Llorente is facing separate charges. Amelia Llorente leaving court (Photo: Europa Press/Getty Images) The defender played on Tuesday evening (Photo: Europa Press/Getty Images) 
Hernandez has been banned from contacting his girlfriend, banned from owning or carrying weapons for two years, and has also been handed a 500-metre restraining order. 
The Atletico star and Miss Llorente reportedly wanted to settle the matter with the magistrate but the case was referred to a criminal court by the prosecutor. Like us on Facebook
